SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent.misc

Class FirebaseService

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.misc.FirebaseService
public class FirebaseService extends Object
Utility service class that wraps Firebase Realtime Database operations for a specific root node.

Each instance of FirebaseService is scoped to a single database path, defined by refString in the constructor. The service provides convenience methods to add, edit, and delete entries or subcollection entries, while automatically logging success and failure outcomes to Logcat.

Example usage:

 FirebaseService eventService = new FirebaseService("Event");
 HashMapinvalid input: '<'String, Object> data = new HashMapinvalid input: '<'>();
 data.put("name", "Hackathon 2025");
 data.put("location", "Edmonton");
 String id = eventService.addEntry(data);

All write operations are asynchronous; success or failure is reported via Logcat with the tag FirestoreTest.

    • FirebaseService

      public FirebaseService(String refString)
      Constructs a FirebaseService for the given database root.
      Parameters:
      refString - the root path within Firebase Realtime Database (e.g., "Event").

  • Method Details

    • addEntry

      public String addEntry(HashMap<String,Object> data)
      Adds a new entry with a generated push key under the current reference.
      Parameters:
      data - key-value pairs representing the new entry.
      Returns:
      the generated Firebase key.

    • addEntry

      public String addEntry(HashMap<String,Object> data, String id)
      Adds or overwrites an entry with the given id under the current reference.
      Parameters:
      data - key-value pairs representing the entry data.
      id - explicit id under which to store the entry.
      Returns:
      the id that was written.

    • deleteEntry

      public void deleteEntry(String id)
      Deletes the entry with the specified id under the current reference.
      Parameters:
      id - the key of the entry to remove.

    • editEntry

      public String editEntry(String id, HashMap<String,Object> data)
      Updates an existing entry with the provided data map.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the entry to update.
      data - key-value pairs containing updated fields.
      Returns:
      the id that was updated.

    • updateSubCollectionEntry

      public void updateSubCollectionEntry(String parentId, String subCollectionName, String subId, HashMap<String,Object> updates)
      Updates a nested subcollection entry within a given parent node.
      Parameters:
      parentId - the parent node id.
      subCollectionName - the name of the subcollection node.
      subId - the id of the child within the subcollection to update.
      updates - the key-value pairs to update.

    • deleteSubCollectionEntry

      public void deleteSubCollectionEntry(String parentId, String subCollectionName, String subId)
      Deletes a nested subcollection entry within a given parent node.
      Parameters:
      parentId - the parent node id.
      subCollectionName - the name of the subcollection node.
      subId - the id of the child within the subcollection to delete.

    • getReference

      public com.google.firebase.database.DatabaseReference getReference()
      Retrieves the underlying DatabaseReference for direct Firebase operations.
      Returns:
      the database reference bound to this service.
